get.summary: Get all accounts for a profile
get.description: Get a list of trading accounts from the profile of the API key.

get.summary: Get a single account by id
get.description: Information for a single account. Use this endpoint when you know the account_id. API key must belong to the same profile as the account.

List the holds of an account that belong to the same profile as the API key. Holds are placed on an account for any active orders or pending withdraw requests. As an order is filled, the hold amount is updated. If an order is canceled, any remaining hold is removed. For withdrawals, the hold is removed after it is completed.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: Used for pagination. Sets start cursor to `before` date.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Used for pagination. Sets end cursor to `after` date.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit on number of results to return.

get.description: Lists ledger activity for an account. This includes anything that would affect the accounts balance - transfers, trades, fees, etc.

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: Returns list of ledger entries from this account id.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Filter results by minimum posted date.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Filter results by maximum posted date.

parameters.description: Used for pagination. Sets start cursor to `before` date.

get.description: Get all addresses stored in the address book.
Gets all the user's available Coinbase wallets (These are the wallets/accounts that are used for buying and selling on www.coinbase.com)

post.description: Generates a one-time crypto address for depositing crypto.
Converts funds from `from` currency to `to` currency. Funds are converted on the `from` account in the `profile_id` profile.

get.description: Gets a currency conversion by id (i.e. USD -> USDC).

Gets a list of all known currencies.
 Note: Not all currencies may be currently in use for trading.
Gets a single currency by id.

post.description: Deposits funds from a www.coinbase.com wallet to the specified `profile_id`.
Deposits funds from a linked external payment method to the specified `profile_id`.

get.description: Get fees rates and 30 days trailing volume.
Get a list of fills. A fill is a partial or complete match on a specific order.

parameters.name: order_id
parameters.description: limit to fills on a specific order. Either `order_id` or `product_id` is required.

parameters.name: product_id
parameters.description: limit to fills on a specific product. Either `order_id` or `product_id` is required.

parameters.name: profile_id
parameters.description: get results for a specific profile

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit on number of results to return.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: Used for pagination. Sets start cursor to `before` date.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Used for pagination. Sets end cursor to `after` date.

get.description: Get cryptographically signed prices ready to be posted on-chain using Compound's Open Oracle smart contract.

List your current open orders. Only open or un-settled orders are returned by default. As soon as an order is no longer open and settled, it will no longer appear in the default request. Open orders may change state between the request and the response depending on market conditions.

parameters.name: profile_id
parameters.description: Filter results by a specific profile_id

parameters.name: product_id
parameters.description: Filter results by a specific product_id

parameters.name: sortedBy
parameters.description: Sort criteria for results.

parameters.name: sorting
parameters.description: Ascending or descending order, by `sortedBy`

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Filter results by minimum posted date

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Filter results by maximum posted date

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: Used for pagination. Sets start cursor to `before` date.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Used for pagination. Sets end cursor to `after` date.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit on number of results to return.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Array with order statuses to filter by.

delete.description: With best effort, cancel all open orders. This may require you to make the request multiple times until all of the open orders are deleted.

200.description: A list of the `id`s of open orders that were successfully cancelled

schema.description: A list of the `id`s of open orders that were successfully cancelled

parameters.name: profile_id
parameters.description: Cancels orders on a specific profile

parameters.name: product_id
parameters.description: Cancels orders on a specific product only

post.description: Create an order. You can place two types of orders: limit and market. Orders can only be placed if your account has sufficient funds. Once an order is placed, your account funds will be put on hold for the duration of the order. How much and which funds are put on hold depends on the order type and parameters specified.

200.description: The new order that was successfully created

get.description: Get a single order by `id`.

parameters.name: order_id
parameters.description: `order_id` is either the exchange assigned id or the client assigned client_oid. When using client_oid it must be preceded by the client: namespace.

delete.description: Cancel a single open order by `{id}`.

200.description: the `id` of the order that was cancelled`

schema.description: the `id` of the order that was cancelled`

parameters.name: order_id
parameters.description: Orders may be canceled using either the exchange assigned id or the client assigned client_oid. When using client_oid it must be preceded by the `client:` namespace.

get.description: Gets a list of the user's linked payment methods.
Gets a list of available currency pairs for trading.
Get information on a single product.
Get a list of open orders for a product. The amount of detail shown can be customized with the `level` parameter.
Historic rates for a product. Rates are returned in grouped buckets. Candle schema is of the form `[timestamp, price_low, price_high, price_open, price_close]`

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Timestamp for starting range of aggregations

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: Timestamp for ending range of aggregations

get.description: Gets 30day and 24hour stats for a product.
Gets snapshot information about the last trade (tick), best bid/ask and 24h volume.
Gets a list the latest trades for a product.
Gets a list of all of the current user's profiles.

post.description: Create a new profile. Will fail if no name is provided or if user already has max number of profiles.
Transfer an amount of currency from one profile to another.

get.description: Information for a single profile. Use this endpoint when you know the profile_id.

put.description: Rename a profile. Names 'default' and 'margin' are reserved.
Deletes the profile specified by `profile_id` and transfers all funds to the profile specified by `to`. Fails if there are any open orders on the profile to be deleted.

get.description: Gets a list of past fills/account reports.

post.description: Generates a report. Reports are either for past account history or past fills on either all accounts or one product's account.

timestamp.description: indicates when the latest datapoint was obtained
timestamp.title: timestamp

messages.description: array contains abi-encoded values [``kind``, ``timestamp``, ``key``, ``value``], where ``kind`` always equals to 'prices', ``timestamp`` is the time when the price was obtained, ``key`` is asset ticker (e.g. 'eth') and ``value`` is asset price
messages.title: messages

signatures.description: array of Ethereum-compatible ECDSA signatures for each message

A list of the `id`s of open orders that were successfully cancelled

usd_volume.description: The 30 days trailing volume in USD.

apiFees.description: Fees defines taker and maker fees for a given user including the volume in USD.

apiGetCoinbasePriceOracleResponse.description:
GetCoinbasePriceOracleResponse returns cryptographically signed prices ready
to be posted on-chain using Compound's Open Oracle smart contract.

apiGetFeesResponse.description: GetFeesResponse is used by the GET /fees.

price.description: price per unit of base currency

size.description: amount of base currency to buy/sell

product_id.description: book the order was placed on

funds.description: amount of quote currency to spend (for market orders)

post_only.description: if true, forces order to be `maker` only

created_at.description: timestamp at which order was placed

done_at.description: timestamp at which order was done

done_reason.description: reason order was done (filled, rejected, or otherwise)

reject_reason.description: reason order was rejected by engine

fill_fees.description: fees paid on current filled amount

filled_size.description: amount (in base currency) of the order that has been filled

settled.description: true if funds have been exchanged and settled

stop_price.description: price (in quote currency) at which to execute the order

trade_id.description: id of trade that created the fill

product_id.description: book the order was placed on

price.description: price per unit of base currency

size.description: amount of base currency to buy/sell

fee.description: fees paid on current filled amount

settled.description: true if funds have been exchanged and settled

usd_volume.description: true if funds have been exchanged and settled

profile_id.description: create order on a specific `profile_id`. If none is passed, defaults to `default` profile.

product_id.description: Book on which to place an order

stop_price.description: Price threshold at which a `stop` order will be placed on the book

price.description: Price per unit of cryptocurrency - required for `limit`/`stop` orders

size.description: Amount of base currency to buy or sell - required for `limit`/`stop` orders and `market` `sell`s

funds.description: Amount of quote currency to buy - required for `market` `buy`s

post_only.description: If true, order will only execute as a `maker` order

client_oid.description: Optional Order ID selected by the user or the frontend client to identify their order

start_date.description: Start date for items to be included in report.

end_date.description: End date for items to be included in report

email.description: Email to send generated report to

profile_id.description: Portfolio - Which portfolio to generate the report for

apiReportType.title:
- otc_fills: real string is `otc-fills`
 - type_1099k_transaction_history: real string is `1099-transaction-history`
 - tax_invoice: real string is `tax-invoice`

apiUnauthorizedResponse.description:
UnauthorizedResponse is the response message for endpoints in rest-gateway that requires authentication.
This message is used to generate the Exchange REST API documentation using OpenAPI format.

protobufNullValue.description:
`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the
`Value` type union.

 The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`.

 - NULL_VALUE: Null value.
